content: rocky cliffs info the undulating cables and a subtly rippling textured pattern in this cowl are both harmonious and continuously interesting rocky cliffs is highly adaptable and can easily be knitted in other fibers or gauges for an equally impressive result the design is as well suited to tonally dyed fibers as it is to solid hues a fun knit perfect for gift-giving because everyone would be pleased to wear this timeless cowl yarn worsted version madelinetosh tosh merino 100% merino wool 1 skein-210yds/192m sample yardage 197yds/180m in color smokestack or any worsted weight yarn approx 197-219yds/180-200m lace version knitted with 3 strands together malabrigo lace 100% wool 50 gr-470yds/430m sample yardage 884yds/775m in color polar morn or any lace weight yarn with 3 strands together approx 766-875yds 700-800m materials 24 minimum 60 cm circular needles worsted us 7 4 5 mm and us 9 5 5 mm crochet hook us 7 5 4 5 mm lace us 6 4 0 mm and us 8 5 0 mm crochet hook us 7 0 4 0 mm stitch marker cable needle tapestry needle gauge - blocked 4 10 cm - in textured pattern worsted 14 stitches x 23 row lace 16 stitches x 27 row a different gauge will affect final size and yardage finished dimensions worsted approx 24 5 62 cm circumference x 13 33 cm height lace approx 25 64 cm circumference x 13 5 34 cm height adjustments the width of the cowl can be adjusted by reducing or adding stitches in a multiple of 2 the length can be adjusted by reducing or adding repeats of the cable pattern please keep in mind to stop after round 14 before starting section 4 different sizes and fits can also be achieved by altering yarn weight and/or needle size s copyright this pattern is for personal non-commercial use only you may not reproduce distribute or sell copies of this pattern in any form or by any instagram @grethamensen means ravelry grethamensen website www grethamensen com please make sure there are no parts or chart s of the pattern visible in email hi@grethamensen com your pictures #rockycliffscowl © gretha mensen #grethamensen 1 instructions round 13 repeat round 1 instructions for the worsted version will appear first with round 14 repeat round 1 changes for the lace version in parentheses round 15 repeat round 6 co 92 112 sts using crochet cast on method with smaller round 16 repeat round 4 needles and crochet hook see tutorial video link on page 3 round 17 repeat round 4 round 18 repeat round 9 place marker for bor and join in the round being careful not to twist the stitches repeat rounds 1-18 2 3 more times 3x 4x total repeat rounds 1-14 once section 1 -
